intro: Dissochaeta simalurensis, commonly known as the Malagasy hairpin grass, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
